STÃƒâ€°PHANE MALLARMÃƒâ€° (1842-1898) was the most radically innovative of nineteenth-century poets, and a key figure in Modernism.  His writings, with their richly sensuous texture and air of slyly intangible mystery, perplexed or outraged many early readers; yet no writer has more profoundly influenced the course of modern poetry -- in English as well as in French. 

This is the fullest collection of MallarmÃƒÂ©'s poetry ever published in English, and the only edition in any language that presents his PoÃƒÂ©sies in the last arrangement known to have been approved by the author.  Prose poems, uncollected verse, and the unique, unclassifiable Un Coup de dÃƒÂ©s... (A Dice Throw...) are also present, including over 20 items that have never previously been translated.  Original spelling, punctuation, and lineation have been preserved throughout.

The lucid, wide-ranging introduction provides a clear survey of MallarmÃƒÂ©'s work and deals fully with the difficulties that may face readers approaching it for the first time.  COLLECTED POEMS offers both MallarmÃƒÂ© lovers and first-time readers a full understanding of this astonishing poet's work.
